meanings.definition: A person who works in a supporting role in a professional field, typically requiring some level of specialized training or education.
meanings.sent1: The paraprofessional in the classroom helps the teacher with tasks.
meanings.sent2: The hospital hired a paraprofessional to assist the doctors and nurses.
meanings.sent3: The paraprofessional accidentally brought a puppet to the meeting instead of the presentation slides.
meanings.sent4: She was the paraprofessional of the office, always ready to lend a helping hand.
meanings.sent5: The diligent paraprofessional made sure everything ran smoothly behind the scenes.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a paraprofessional role or position.
meanings.sent1: The paraprofessional training program provided valuable skills for the job.
meanings.sent2: Her paraprofessional duties included administrative tasks and client support.
meanings.sent3: The paraprofessional dress code required a neat and professional appearance.
meanings.sent4: His paraprofessional approach to problem-solving was methodical and effective.
meanings.sent5: The paraprofessional team worked together seamlessly to achieve their goals.
